result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan A. Schaper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

Per Standing Order Defendant to pay $10 Drug Offender Diversion Surcharge

--maintain absolute sobriety
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 per Agent
--random drug screening, at least one time per month
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--anger management counseling
--to provide DNA sample upon demand

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

supervisions.notes: The Court grants civil judgment for any unpaid costs/fees/assessments.

On Count #1, The Court sentences Mr. Schaper to 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail with work release/Huber privileges.

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

--The Court authorizes transfer of the sentence to Waukesha County Jail, so long as it is served as would be in Jefferson County



****PER 8/22/2016 - IT IS ORDERED -  Judgment of Convictions shall be amended to allow the defendant release under Huber to see his sister at LifeCare Hospital of Wisconsin, with a timeframe and conditions set by the Jefferson County Sheriff. *****

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan A. Schaper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Refer Debt to the WI Dept of Revenue, along with supporting Reminder Notices.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the stipulation is granted, the Judgments of Conviction shall be so modified. JOC shall be amended to allow the defendant release under Huber to see his sister at LifeCare Hospital of Wisconsin, with a timeframe and conditions set by the Jefferson County Sheriff.
to Amend the Judgment of Conviction

Case called at 3:32pm [mo]
Defendant Nathan A. Schaper in court, in custody with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Counsel verify receipt of revocation order and warrant; no factual corrections
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Schaper

On Count #1, The Court sentences Mr. Schaper to 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail.
On Count #2, The Court sentences Mr. Schaper to 2 months in the Jefferson County Jail, to be served consecutive to sentence in count #1

The sentences in Count #1 and #2 are with work release/Huber privileges.
The Court grants civil judgment for any unpaid costs/fees/assessments.

133 days credit for time served

The Court authorizes transfer of the sentence to Waukesha County Jail, so long as it is served as would be in Jefferson County
recess: 4:15pm
Copy of letter from Court to Defendant re: correspondence received 6-27-2016
from Defendant requesting to reschedule the 7-18-2016 court date
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 18, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
The Court believes that this letter was intended for SPD Whitney Hageman. No Action by the Court. Forward to SPD.
DNA Proof of Submission form received and completed by JCJ

Cases 15CM64 and 15CM337 called together at 8:13am [mo]
Defendant Nathan A. Schaper in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance in both cases; provides Victim Impact Statement 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Counts #1 and #2 of Case 15CM337; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 15CM64

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Schaper

On Counts #1 and #2 of Case 15CM337, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--maintain absolute sobriety
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 per Agent
--random drug screening, at least one time per month
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--anger management counseling
--to provide DNA sample upon demand
--On Count #1: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #2: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
recess: 8:35

Cases 15CM64 and 15CM337 called together at 10:53am [mo]
Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant, Nathan Schaper does NOT appear.

Atty. Svehlek gives reasoning for Mr. Schaper's non-appearance; requests a Plea/ Sentencing date 
--No objection from ADA Hall

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 10:58am

NEXT: Plea/Sentencing on 1/21/16 at 8:10am

Cases 15CM337 and 15CM64 called together at 2:48pm [mo]
Defendant Nathan A. Schaper in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CM337(Initial Appearance occurs):
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $1500 signature bond, with conditions: 
--No presence at W1031 Hunter Lane in Ixonia
--No discussion of the facts of the case with Sondra or Laura Schaper
--No consumption of alcoholic beverages
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia


As to Case 15CM64(STC occurs):
--Atty. Svehlek requests that this case be scheduled with 15CM337
recess
